ClassDesc: Fling animation is an animation that continues an initial momentum (most often from gesture velocity) and gradually slows down. The fling animation will come to a stop when the velocity of the animation is below the threshold derived from @B_android#support#animation#DynamicAnimation#setMinimumVisibleChange_E@, or when the value of the animation has gone beyond the min or max value defined via @B_android#support#animation#DynamicAnimation#setMinValue_E@ or @B_android#support#animation#DynamicAnimation#setMaxValue_E@. It is recommended to restrict the fling animation with min and/or max value, such that the animation can end when it goes beyond screen bounds, thus preserving CPU cycles and resources.
